answerText: The Compleat Angler[10] Walton's Lives also told of this man who wrote about "A broken ALTAR Made of heart and cemented with tears" in one of his pattern poems. He wrote the collection The Temple.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 8 | 17 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This book includes some poems by John Chalkhill, and its first edition was published after its author published lives of John Donne and Henry Wotton, which would be included as part of his collected Lives. [10] Name this book that was originally a dialogue between Piscator and Viator but was revised to also include the falconer Auceps.
